description: Wander cobblestone streets and sunlit cafés — a soundtrack for drifting through French afternoons.

items.name: The Louvre Museum
items.description: The gorgeous museum of Louvre showcases art and sculptures by renowned artists of the World. Undeniably Louvre is no #1 in our list of most popular museums in France and one of the must-visit places to see in Paris. Located in the heart of the city, on the banks of River Seine, the mighty edifice of Louvre museum was originally a fort of the French army. Sprawling over 21,000 hectares, this museum is divided into different galleries like Egyptian, Oriental, Islamic, Roman, Greek, and British. Every gallery is endowed with marvelous collections of paintings, sculptures, and artifacts of the ancient and medieval era. If you are an art lover, Louvre Museum in Paris should be on the top of your bucket list.
items.opening_hours_text: 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. On Wednesdays, the museum is open until 10:00 PM. Louvre is closed on Tuesdays.

items.name: Musée d’Orsay
items.description: One of the famous museums in France, Musee de Orsay is another place of wonder. Displaying eminent artwork of Jean Auguste, Johan Barthold Jongkind, Berthe Morisot and Eugène Carrière etc, this age-old museum is a restored national monument and attracts a plethora of art and history enthusiasts, round the year. This is considered as one of the most charming places to see in Paris, France.
items.location_hint: 1 Rue de la Légion d'Honneur, 75007 Paris, France
items.opening_hours_text: 9: 30 am to 6 pm on all days except Thursdays, when the museum closes at 9:45 pm. The place is closed on Mondays.

items.name: Musée de l’Armée
items.description: Reputed as the national military museum of France, Musée de l'Armée is located at the heart of Paris and was opened to the public in 1905. With 6 departments namely main courtyard and artillery collection, old armor and weapons, modern department, contemporary department, Charles de Gaulle monument, and cabinet insolites, the museum exhibits objects and artifacts of the French army and allures travelers of all kinds. An array of weapons, armors, private uniforms, crown collections, marshals' batons and ceremonial swords, displayed at various galleries of the museum, are the main exhibits other than paintings and archives of French war history.

items.name: Musée Rodin
items.description: Dedicated to the French sculptor Auguste Rodin, Musee Rodin is another interesting museum in France. Housed in a vintage building, this museum features artistic décor and spacious galleries, displaying as much as 8000 paintings, 6600 sculptures and 7000 objects of art. In addition, the place also boasts of an impressive archive of more than 80000 old photographs. Moreover, Musee Rodin also has a dedicated gallery for the works of Camille Claudel. Surrounded by a luxuriant garden and a small lake; Musee Rodin is one of the best sightseeing places in Paris.
items.opening_hours_text: 10:00 am to 5:45 pm. The museum is closed on Mondays.

items.name: Musée Jacquemart
items.description: Located in proximity to Place de la Concorde, this is another place of marvelous artwork display. Regarded as one of the quaintest museums in France, Musée Jacquemart-André houses famous paintings and sculptures of Henri Matisse, Picasso, Henri Rousseau, Alfred Sisley, and Chaim Soutine.
items.opening_hours_text: 10 am to 6 pm. On Monday, the museum closes at 8:30 pm.

items.name: Palace of Versailles
items.description: Palace of Versailles is another eminent name in the list of best museums in France, Paris and is definitely a must-visit. The gorgeous structure, musical fountains and artistic décor fascinate every traveler who pays a visit there. The objects of art, artifacts, armors, paintings, and sculptures of French rulers displayed at Versailles Palace museum, probably reflects the true essence and spirit of the medieval and Renaissance period of history. Take a petite tram ride to explore the lush green sprawling garden, surrounding the palace and enjoy the surreal beauty of the place.

items.name: Galerie Tapiezo Contemporary Art Gallery and Museum
items.opening_hours_text: 11 am to 5 pm. The place is closed on every Sunday.

items.name: Carrières de Lumières
items.location_hint: Route de Maillane, 13520 Les Baux-de-Provence, France

items.name: Grand Site Aven d’Orgnac
items.description: Grand Site Aven d'Orgnac is one of the most exciting museums in France and the display of various geographical and topographical features is surely the stunner. Huge caverns, limestone topography and crystal formations are spread over three expansive caves and English-speaking guides take everyone to a guided walk through the underground chambers of this amazing natural museum.

items.name: Centre Georges Pompidou
items.description: The Centre Georges Pompidou has always enthralled visitors with its bizarre architecture since its establishment in the year 1977. Its Lego-like walls have always blown the senses of art lovers and even kids that visit. Ranging from surrealism to pop art, the CGP has two floors full of over 65,000-plus pieces of modern art from France's National Museum of Modern Art. What else makes it one of the best museums in France is its whopping 245-piece assortment of works by Matisse. And once you're done with what the museum offers inside its walls, you must step out to enjoy the sweeping panoramic views of the city from the building's 6th floor!

items.name: Musée National d’Art Moderne
items.description: The National Museum of Modern Art has earned its place in the list of the best museums in France owing mainly to its massive size. It has been documented as the second largest museum in France, spanning an area of approx. 17,000 square meters. Housing the most unique and notable pieces of modern artwork in France, the Musee National d'Art Moderne attracts a huge number of visitors from around the globe every year. Believed to be the first ever museum in Europe to be established with the prime motive of promoting contemporary art, it is an indispensable part of every history geek and art fanatic's travel itinerary.
